DOC.brief_summary: Purpose of the study is the assessment of interrectal distance and dimensions of the muscles of the lateral abdominal wall in pregnant and non-pregnant women
DOC.brief_title: Diastasis Recti Abdominis and Abdominal Muscles
DOC.detailed_description: - Purpose of the study is the assessment of interrectal distance and dimensions of the muscles of the lateral abdominal wall in pregnant and non-pregnant women - Assessment via ultrasound measurement transabdominally - 3 groups of participants: 1.) 20 pregnant women, who have never been pregnant before; 2.) 40 pregnant women with their first pregnancy, followed over the course of pregnancy; 3.) 20 women1-5 days after delivery (10 after spontaneous delivery, 10 after planned cesarean section) - comparison between pregnant and non-pregnant women; evaluation of influence of pregnancy and mode of delivery
DOC.criteria: nonpregnant women aged 2045 y with a BMI < 30 kg/m2 who never were pregnant pregnant women aged 2045 y with a BMI < 30 kg/m2 before pregnancy abdominal preoperations chronical lung diseases constipation maternal collagenosis polyhydramnion (AFI > 25) uterus fibroids > 10 cm inability to perform Valsalva
